utterance.content: You said he panicked?

utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.content: Oh, you remember that next time I sing the peanut butter song in front of your friends.

utterance.content: Of course I didn’t say a word. It’s none of your damn business.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT

utterance.speaker: LAURIE
utterance.content: I have a family, Detective Beckett. Their father is dead. What use is dragging their names through the mud providing fodder for late night comedians?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When did you know?

utterance.speaker: LAURIE
utterance.content: The trust called to confirm the stock sale. utterance.content: So what did you decide to do?

utterance.speaker: LAURIE
utterance.content: Well, between public humiliation and blackmail, I chose blackmail, and I told him to make it go away.

utterance.content: So what do you think happened that night?

utterance.speaker: LAURIE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: LAURIE
utterance.content: You see those wives at the inevitable press conference, standing stone-faced next to their men, and you think, 'How do they do that? How do they just stand there? How do they watch as their whole world melts into a spotlight of shame?'

utterance.content: No! No. I was home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT

utterance.speaker: LAURIE

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mr. Nesbit, you have the right to remain silent… hey, hey!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Stop running bro, campaign's over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh yes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wasn’t quite finished back there, Mr. Nesbit. You have the right to remain silent; anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law....

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: After we found the weapon in Nesbit’s office he made a full confession. He got Horn to call her husband and get him down to the overpass and then he took care of the rest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Politics was Nesbit’s life. He figured if the scandal broke, his career would be over and he’d be damaged goods.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Sad thing is he was probably right. So what happens to the girls?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Horn had a sister upstate; she’s coming down tomorrow to pick 'em up from social services.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Good. And the rug?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A red herring. Nesbit heard they were dumping a bunch of them and figured it would keep us off his trail.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Nice work. Very impressive. Oh, and -- ah, you too, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Just yanking your chain, Detective, just yanking your chain.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, Dad, where are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where am I supposed to be?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Fire ants, eyeballs?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right! Stall for me, I’m on my way. Oooh, sorry, sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "She stood there in stunned disbelief as the light in his eyes dimmed. He reached out for her and she took his hand, squeezing it for the very last time. She felt her heart stop a beat and in that moment, she knew he was gone. Darkness fell across the face of the city and across her face as well. 'Good,' she thought, as the wind gathered up her hair, 'no one... will see my tears.' " Thank you...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know if I would say that I was…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, to what do I owe this very unexpected pleasure?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me, thank you. I just figured if you're going to bother me at my work I should bother you at yours. That was um, quite a reading, very moving.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you making fun of me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: " 'Good,' she thought as the wind gathered up her hair, 'no one will see my tears.' How does wind gather up hair? I’m just curious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you’re telling me how to do my job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Irritating, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh oh oh, oh! Look at you. Denise from the Ledger says you are going to be number one this week, and look! Everyone is buying your book. Now don’t you feel silly for believing all of those reviews?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, yes I do.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, let's just hope Nikki Heat does as well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nikki Heat?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: The character he’s basing on you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nikki ... Heat.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can I talk to you for a second?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Let them be…

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I want to hear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of a name is Nikki Heat?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A cop name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s a stripper name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I told you she was kinda slutty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Change it, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, hang on a sec. Think of the titles. Summer Heat, Heat Wave, In Heat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Change the name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Change it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not speaking about this…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have artistic integrity, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Artistic integrity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes! If I, if I…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Change the name, Castle, today.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I do it now, what next? What more demands would you demand…
